abstract: Since April, colleges and universities have been competing against each other to reduce their carbon footprints. The winners are in.
snippet: Since April, colleges and universities have been competing against each other to reduce their carbon footprints. The winners are in.
lead_paragraph: The University of Maryland at College Park and Rio Salado College in Tempe, Ariz., are expected to earn bragging rights for their green ambitions — at least according to organizers of the “America’s Greenest Campus” contest, which pitted colleges and universities against one another to reduce their carbon footprints.
